DOC.brief_summary: The aim was to determine the knowledge attitudes, beliefs, and practices regarding HIV in a population of sex workers in French Guiana and in the Brazilian border town of Oiapoque. A standardized questionnaire was administered face to face to sex workers. Analysis of the questionnaires led to descriptive statistics. Multiple logistic regression models were computed to determine the predictors of condom use.
DOC.brief_title: Knowledge Attitudes Beliefs and Practices Relative to HIV Among Sex Workers in French Guiana
DOC.criteria: sex worker not wishing to participate
